column4: need help, trying to get printer working, went to HP website, it sent me to a site for downloading linux drivers, the site told after I downloaded it, to "cd Desktop" then to type "sh hplip-3.9.6.run" I tried that, and it didn't work, so then I did "sudo" then the rest of it, and it's always giving me "sh: can't open hplip-3.9.6.run"

need help, trying to get printer working, went to HP website, it sent me to a site for downloading linux drivers, the site told after I downloaded it, to "cd Desktop" then to type "sh hplip-3.9.6.run" I tried that, and it didn't work, so then I did "sudo" then the rest of it, and it's always giving me "sh: can't open hplip-3.9.6.run"
- have you changed the permissions for the *.sh file?
I don't understand all that stuff
how do I change permissions for sh?
right click file, permissions tab, check "allow execution"
it says it can't open it
well I tried connecting, and it needs drivers, ubuntu couldn't find them automatically, so I tried going to HP, and this is where I've gotten to
have you tried what ctmjr suggested
getting the same thing no matter what
ok I got it now, thanks for all the help, it was a user error
I messed up, but I got it working onw
no I didn't but I'll check it out, though I did get it working
